1 Wrangling Challenges Using Alternative 2

##Patent Dominance: What US company / corporation has the most patents? List the 10 US companies with the most assigned/granted patents..

DATA IMPORT

2 Define column types for vroom

col_types <- list(
  id = col_character(),
  type = col_character(),
  number = col_character(),
  country = col_character(),
  date = col_date("%Y-%m-%d"),
  abstract = col_character(),
  title = col_character(),
  kind = col_character(),
  num_claims = col_double(),
  filename = col_character(),
  withdrawn = col_double()
)

3 – Using Alternative 2: The reduced data set for the year 2014

4 Read the data into a tibble

patent_tbl <- vroom(
  file = "C:/Users/arpit/OneDrive/Documents/GitHub/repo/ss23-bdsb-arpitaprayag/assets/data/Patent_data_reduced/Patent_data_reduced/patent.tsv", 
  delim = "\t"
  #col_types = col_types,
  #na = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
#> Rows: 327014 Columns: 3
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: "\t"
#> chr  (1): id
#> dbl  (1): num_claims
#> date (1): date
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
assignee_tbl <- vroom(
  file = "C:/Users/arpit/OneDrive/Documents/GitHub/repo/ss23-bdsb-arpitaprayag/assets/data/Patent_data_reduced/Patent_data_reduced/assignee.tsv", 
  delim = "\t", 
  col_types = col_types,
  na = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
#> Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: number,
#> country, date, abstract, title, kind, num_claims, filename, withdrawn
patent_assignee_tbl <- vroom(
  file = "C:/Users/arpit/OneDrive/Documents/GitHub/repo/ss23-bdsb-arpitaprayag/assets/data/Patent_data_reduced/Patent_data_reduced/patent_assignee.tsv", 
  delim = "\t", 
  col_types = col_types,
  na = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
#> Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: id, type,
#> number, country, date, abstract, title, kind, num_claims, filename, withdrawn
uspc_tbl <- vroom(
  file = "C:/Users/arpit/OneDrive/Documents/GitHub/repo/ss23-bdsb-arpitaprayag/assets/data/Patent_data_reduced/Patent_data_reduced/uspc.tsv", 
  delim = "\t", 
  col_types = col_types,
  na = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
#> Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: id, type,
#> number, country, date, abstract, title, kind, num_claims, filename, withdrawn

5 Join Tables

patent_joined_table <- patent_assignee_tbl %>%
  inner_join(assignee_tbl, by = c("assignee_id" = "id")) %>%
  inner_join(patent_tbl, by = c("patent_id" = "id"))

6 Patent Dominance: What US company/corporation has the most patents?

##List the 10 US companies with the most assigned/granted patents.

us_patent_counts <- patent_joined_table %>%
  group_by(organization) %>%
  summarise(total_patents = n()) %>%
  arrange(desc(total_patents))

top_10_us_companies <- head(us_patent_counts, 10)

top_10_us_companies

#What US organization had the most patents granted in August 2014? List the top 10 companies with the most new granted patents for August 2014.

us_patent_counts_aug_2014 <- patent_joined_table %>%
  filter(format(date, "%Y-%m") == "2014-08") %>%
  group_by(organization) %>%
  summarise(total_patents = n()) %>%
  arrange(desc(total_patents)) %>%
  select(organization, total_patents)

top_10_us_companies_aug_2014 <- head(us_patent_counts_aug_2014, 10)

top_10_us_companies_aug_2014
